text: Bill Hagan (born June 17, 1931) is a Canadian former professional ice hockey left winger, who was a member of the Jr. A Barrie Flyers under Hap Emms, who won the Memorial Cup in 1950–51. Hagan also played in the AHL with the Buffalo Bisons in 1951–52. He also played for the Vancouver Canucks of the PCHL in 1951–52, the Vancouver Canucks of the WHL in 1952–53, the Charlottetown Islanders of the MMHL in 1952–53, and the Troy Uncle Sam Trojans of the EHL in 1952–53. Hagan then played three years in the OHA Sr. A leagues for the Owen Sound Mercurys 1954–57. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Barrie Flyers players Category:Buffalo Bisons (AHL) players Category:Canadian ice hockey left wingers Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Sportspeople from Barrie Category:Vancouver Canucks (WHL) players
title: Bill Hagan
